thread.title: EastEnders crew "relieved" Danny Dyer has taken a break after he divided cast with 'Ian Beale row'
thread.title_full: EastEnders crew "relieved" Danny Dyer has taken a break after he divided cast with 'Ian Beale row'

author: mirror
title: EastEnders crew "relieved" Danny Dyer has taken a break after he divided cast with 'Ian Beale row'
text:
EastEnders crew "relieved" Danny Dyer has taken a break after he divided cast with 'Ian Beale row' TV insiders say the actor was less-than-charming about his co-star, who plays Ian Beale Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
He is currently on a break from hit BBC show EastEnders. 
But it seems that not everybody is missing actor Danny Dyer - especially after reports he threw shade at fellow TV star Adam Woodyatt, who plays legendary Ian Beale in the award-winning soap. 
According to a report in the Daily Star , crew-members are relieved by the 39 year-old's sabbatical after he made a handful of disparaging comments about his peer. 
Dyer, who plays landlord Mick Carter, first seemed to make a barbed comment about Woodyatt's continued presence in Albert Square, saying: “Adam has played one role. He’s auditioned once in his whole career". Danny Dyer is currently on a break from the BBC show (Photo: BBC) Ian Beale, played by Adam Woodyatt, is one of the show's few original characters (Photo: BBC) Read More 
He then added that he possesses the most acting experience due to films such as Human Traffic and The Football Factory. 
“Out of every soap actor I’ve got the most experience,” he mused, confidently. 
Clearly unimpressed by his swagger, one inside source said: “When he says things about fellow actors, it obviously has an effect on everyone. Adam’s loved by everyone.” The 38 year-old is believed to have bragged about his past experience as popularity (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Woodyatt and his on-screen family are TV faves (Photo: BBC) Read More EastEnders' June Brown "absolutely delighted" with Dot portrait to mark her 90th birthday 
However, an EastEnders spokeswoman refuted the claims, telling the Daily Star: “There is absolutely no truth in this. Danny is an extremely popular member of cast and respected by everyone on the show.” 
Adam said: “This is news to me considering Danny and I had a great chat before he went on his break. As Danny would say, it’s pony.” 
Dyer is believed to be in South Africa on a break from filming the BBC1 soap. A source said: “He’s there to sort his life out.” 
He is expected back on the EastEnders set next month. 
The Mirror have contacted representatives for both Danny Dyer and EastEnders, but are yet to receive a response. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
